main event: A witness reported seeing a bright, illuminated object with a white center and red outer edge flying parallel to the ground in August 1963.
interesting points: The object had a white tail that was about twice the size of the object itself.
The sighting was reported to the U.S. Air Force, who indicated that the event was likely caused by a meteor based on the limited data provided.
The Air Force stated that there has never been any evidence that unidentified flying objects represent spaceships from other planets, and that observations typically contradict this theory.
The Air Force analysis suggested that UFO sightings may be caused by natural phenomena like atmospheric conditions or meteors.
The witness was asked to provide a more detailed report and fill out a form 164 for further investigation.
sighted object: Bright, illuminated object with a white center and red outer edge
photographs: Yes, but not included in the report
